I can't get the game to read my CDs anymore.
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Laboratory: Technical Research On The Monster Rancher CD Read Process: General Q & A: I can't get the game to read my CDs anymore.
By Stoopiddood9 on Friday, June 6, 2008 - 08:41 pm:

So I've successfully created about 10 discs in the past utilizing the .txt Image, but now I've run into some issues. I can't get my PS2 to read any of the new discs I'm making. Is there something I'm supposed to be doing differently since I made an image from a CD with a blank .txt file on it?

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 7, 2008 - 09:29 am:

For PS2, which is far touchier about what it will read, use an audio track not a text file.

By Stoopiddood9 on Saturday, June 7, 2008 - 10:06 am:

I'm trying to figure out how to get my computer to burn a CD with a new .wav file on it.

It just. Won't. Do it.

By Stoopiddood9 on Saturday, June 7, 2008 - 10:19 am:

I managed to burn it but... The PS2 still won't read it.

I managed to get it to read one of the earlier discs I made, a purebred Gali. The TOC for the Gali disc had something extra in it. It had two tracks in it. When put into my computer, my computer thought the disc had a blank text file on it.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, June 7, 2008 - 12:42 pm:

.wav file won't work either, it's computer data that the PS2 is not designed to read.

You need a REGULAR AUDIO track, as in like a music CD from the store with 74 minutes of music on it.

By Stoopiddood9 on Saturday, June 7, 2008 - 01:59 pm:

It still won't work. I decided to figure out if it was the disc, so I tried to mount the image. Alcohol said that it had an error reading the sub-channel file.
